explosives.rationale: Containing no atom groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#2074)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Based on the classification by UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (Category 6.1, UN#2074)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the flashing point is 424degC (ICSC,2004)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available - melting point: 84.5degC (ICSC, 2004), test temperature: 140degC

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 129mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 124mg/kg (EHC 49, 1985), 175mg/kg (EU-RAR No.24, 2002) and 203mg/kg (EU-RAR No.24, 2002).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of 400mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 400mg/kg (EHC 49,1985) and 1,148mg/kg (EU-RAR No.24, 2002).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the testing data of rabbit skin irritation tests (EU-RAR No.24, 2002) and the data on human health effects (EU-RAR No.24, 2002 and ACGIH 7th, 2005), suggesting that the substance "causes mild skin irritation".

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description found in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (EU-RAR No.24, 2002): "eye irritation was observed but disappeared during the observation period of 21 days".

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests (EU-RAR No.24, 2002), suggesting that the substance "causes skin sensitization".

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on positive data on in vivo germ cell heritable mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests, specific locus tests), described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.35 (2004).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the fact that the substance is classified as Group 2A by IARC (1994) and Category R by U.S. NTP (2005).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the evidence of decreased number of foetuses per brood, decline in the ability of males to impregnate females, increased incidence of preimplantation embryo death, etc. at dosing levels causing no general toxicity (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No. 35, 2004).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "hallucination, hypotension, epileptic convulsion and peripheral neuropathy, of which peripheral neuropathy being observed also after two months" (EU-RAR No.24 (2002) and the evidence from animal studies including "tremor, hyperreflexia, repetitive tonic-clonic convulsion, asynergia of the hind limb, asynergia of posture and movement, dysfunction of hind limb muscles, vacuolation of sperm cell nuclei" (EU-RAR No.24 (2002), suggesting poor recoverability from neuropathy. The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "disturbance in gait, dysmnesia, hallucination, speech disorder, numbness of the limbs, abnormal sweating of hands and feet, taste disorder" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No. 35, 2004) and "muscular weakness, asynergia of arms, tremor of hands, sensory disorder (vibration, pain, tactile and position sensations), decreased tendon and plantar reflexes, nystagmus, diffuse fibrosing of nerve fibers and swelling of axons associated with disappearance and demyelination (EU-RAR No.24, 2002)" and the evidence from animal studies including "loss of balance, decreased vision, weakness of hind limbs, tremor of forelimbs, axon degeneration in peripheral nerves and optic tract fibers, spinal cord damage, testicular atrophy, decreased numbers of sperm cells and spermatocytes, decreased sperm count" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No. 35, 2004). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 72 hours EC50=16.9mg/L of (EU-RAR, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 70% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=-0.67 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
